abstract: Editorial supports Missouri prosecutors for showing the courage that the Roman Catholic Church leaders lacked by indicting Bishop Robert William Finn for failing to report a priest suspected of child abuse; credits Missouri officials for puncturing myth that church law, and a bishop's authority, take precedence over criminal law and the safety of children.
snippet: Prosecutors showed the courage that Catholic leaders lacked when Bishop Robert Finn was indicted for failing to report a priest suspected of child abuse.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors showed the courage that Catholic leaders lacked when Bishop Robert Finn was indicted for failing to report a priest suspected of child abuse.

headline.seo: Accountability in the Catholic Church in Missouri
